title: What is RSO (Rick Simpson Oil)?
content:
By Robin Roy Krigslund-Hansen | 12+ years in [CBD](/glossary/cannabidiol) industry Last updated: January 2026 ---

Quick Answer

Rick Simpson Oil (RSO) is a concentrated, full-extract cannabis oil created using a specific ethanol extraction method. Named after Canadian Rick Simpson who popularized it in the early 2000s, traditional RSO contains high levels of [THC](/glossary/thc). CBD-RSO variants made from hemp are now available, offering a similar full-plant extract without the high THC content.

Key Takeaways

  • ✓ Full-plant extract: Contains the complete cannabinoid and [terpene](/glossary/terpenes) profile
  • ✓ Traditional RSO: Made from high-THC cannabis (not legal everywhere)
  • ✓ CBD RSO: Hemp-derived version with high CBD, minimal THC
  • ✓ Highly concentrated: Very potent compared to regular oils
  • ✓ Specific extraction: Uses ethanol/[alcohol](/conditions/alcohol) extraction method
--- ## Research Snapshot | Metric | Value | |--------|-------| | Studies reviewed | 88 | | Human clinical trials | 88 | | Total participants | 29+ | | Evidence strength | ●●●○○ Moderate | *Research on CBD and bioavailability continues to evolve. [Browse all studies](/research)* ## The History of RSO ### Rick Simpson's Story Rick Simpson is a Canadian who claims he used a homemade cannabis oil to treat his skin [cancer](/conditions/cancer) in 2003. After his experience, he: - Developed a specific extraction protocol - Shared his method freely online - Produced oil for others in his community - Became an advocate for cannabis medicine ### Important Context Simpson's claims about RSO's effectiveness for cancer have not been proven in clinical trials. While his story inspired many, it's crucial to understand: - Anecdotal reports don't equal scientific proof - No cannabis extract is an approved cancer treatment - Always consult healthcare providers for serious conditions - RSO should not replace conventional medical care ## Key Numbers: RSO Concentration and Composition | Metric | Value | |--------|-------| | Traditional RSO THC content | 60-90% | | CBD RSO THC content | <0.3% | | Total cannabinoid content | 60-90% | | Hemp THC legal limit | 0.3% | These concentration levels show RSO's highly potent nature compared to regular CBD oils, with traditional versions containing extremely high THC levels while hemp-derived CBD RSO maintains legal compliance. ## What Makes RSO Unique ### Characteristics | Property | Description | |----------|-------------| | **Consistency** | Thick, tar-like, sticky | | **Color** | Dark brown to black | | **Cannabinoid content** | Very high (60-90% total) | | **Traditional THC level** | High (60-90% THC) | | **CBD RSO THC level** | Low (under 0.3%) | | **Extraction method** | Ethanol/alcohol | ### The Extraction Process **Simpson's Original Method:** 1. Hemp or cannabis soaked in solvent (ethanol) 2. Solution agitated to extract [cannabinoids](/glossary/minor-cannabinoids) 3. Liquid strained from plant material 4. Solvent evaporated with gentle heat 5. Resulting in thick, concentrated oil **Safety Note:** Home extraction can be dangerous due to flammable solvents. Commercial production is safer. ## RSO vs CBD Oil ### Key Differences | Feature | Traditional RSO | CBD RSO | [CBD Oil](/articles/cbd-oil-guide) | |---------|-----------------|---------|----------| | **THC content** | High (60-90%) | Low (<0.3%) | Low/none | | **CBD content** | Varies | High | Varies | | **Consistency** | Thick, sticky | Thick, sticky | Liquid | | **Legal status** | Restricted | Legal (hemp) | Legal (hemp) | | **Diluted** | No | No | Yes (in carrier) | | **Concentration** | Very high | Very high | Lower | ### Why Choose CBD RSO People choose CBD-derived RSO for: - Full-plant hemp extract benefits - Maximum cannabinoid concentration - [Entourage effect](/glossary/entourage-effect) potential - Legal accessibility (hemp-derived) - Similar profile to traditional RSO minus high THC ## Types of RSO Available ### Based on Cannabis Source **Traditional RSO (THC-Dominant):** - Made from high-THC cannabis strains - Contains 60-90% THC - Only legal in cannabis-legal jurisdictions - Psychoactive effects **CBD RSO (Hemp-Derived):** - Made from hemp plants - High CBD, low THC (under 0.3%) - Federally legal under 2018 Farm Bill - Non-intoxicating **Balanced RSO:** - Contains significant CBD and THC - Various CBD:THC ratios - Available in medical/recreational states - Varying levels of psychoactivity ### Product Formats RSO is typically sold in: - Oral syringes (for precise dosing) - Small jars - Capsules (pre-dosed) - Suppositories (specialized use) ## How RSO Is Used ### Administration Methods **Oral/Sublingual:** - Applied under tongue - Absorbed through oral mucosa - Can also be swallowed - Most common method **In Food/Capsules:** - Mixed into food - Put in empty capsules - Easier to mask taste - Slower absorption **Topical:** - Applied directly to skin - For localized issues - Not absorbed systemically ### Dosing Considerations RSO is highly concentrated. CBD RSO dosing: - Start with rice-grain sized amount - [Titrate](/glossary/titration) slowly upward - Allow days between increases - Much stronger than regular CBD oil ## CBD RSO Benefits and Uses ### Potential Advantages The concentrated [full-spectrum](/glossary/full-spectrum) nature may offer: - Maximum [entourage effect](/glossary/entourage-effect) - Full cannabinoid profile - Complete terpene content - High potency per volume ### Common Uses for CBD RSO People use CBD RSO for: - Wellness supplementation - [Sleep](/conditions/sleep) support - Discomfort management - General supplementation - When other CBD products feel insufficient ## Quality Considerations ### What to Look For 1. **[Third-party testing](/glossary/third-party-testing)**: [Certificate of Analysis](/glossary/certificate-of-analysis) showing: - Cannabinoid potency (CBD, THC, minor cannabinoids) - Terpene profile - Residual solvent testing - Pesticides and heavy metals 2. **Source material**: - Organic hemp preferred - US-grown for quality standards - Reputable company 3. **THC compliance**: - Under 0.3% for legal hemp RSO - Verified by lab testing ### Red Flags - No lab testing available - Unknown hemp source - Unrealistic health claims - Very low prices - No clear cannabinoid content ## Legal Status ### CBD RSO (Hemp-Derived) - Federally legal under 2018 Farm Bill - Must contain under 0.3% THC - Some state restrictions may apply - Can purchase online ### Traditional RSO (THC) - Illegal federally (Schedule I) - Legal in recreational cannabis states - Available in medical marijuana programs - Cannot cross state lines ## Safety and Precautions ### General Safety - Start with very small amounts - RSO is extremely potent - Know your product's cannabinoid content - THC RSO causes strong psychoactive effects - Store away from [children](/conditions/children) and [pets](/conditions/veterinary) ### Interactions and Contraindications - May interact with medications (via CYP450) - Not recommended during [pregnancy](/conditions/pregnancy)/[breastfeeding](/conditions/breastfeeding) - Consult healthcare provider before use - Don't use if allergic to cannabis ### Not a Cure Despite claims, RSO is not a proven treatment for: - Cancer - Serious diseases - Any medical condition Always work with healthcare providers for serious health issues. ## Related Articles - [What is CBD Oil?](/articles/cbd-oil-guide) - [What is CBD Crude Oil?](/articles/cbd-crude-oil-guide) - [What are CBD Concentrates?](/articles/cbd-concentrates-guide) - [What is Full-Spectrum CBD?](/articles/what-is-full-spectrum-cbd) ## My Take After testing dozens of RSO products over the years, I've learned that extraction method and starting material make all the difference. True RSO should be dark, sticky, and incredibly potent—if it's light-colored or easy to handle, it's likely been over-processed or diluted. The best CBD-RSO I've tested comes from whole-plant hemp extracts that maintain the original terpene profiles. The biggest mistake I see consumers make is starting with too large a dose. RSO is concentrated—I always recommend beginning with a rice grain-sized amount, even for CBD versions. Many people also confuse RSO with other cannabis oils; authentic RSO has that distinctive tar-like consistency from the ethanol extraction process. This product type works best for experienced users seeking maximum cannabinoid density or those dealing with serious wellness concerns where high concentrations matter. If you're new to cannabis extracts, start elsewhere. RSO demands respect and patience—it's not a beginner-friendly product, but when sourced properly, it delivers unmatched potency and full-spectrum benefits. --- ## Related Studies Research related to this topic: - [Medical cannabis or cannabinoids for [chronic pain](/conditions/chronic_pain): a clinical practice guideline (2021)](/research/study/medical-cannabis-or-cannabinoids-for-chronic-[pain](/conditions/pain)-a-clinical-2021-9c4515) - Human Trial - [ASRA Pain Medicine consensus guidelines on the management of the perioperative p... (2023)](/research/study/asra-pain-medicine-consensus-guidelines-on-the-management-of-2023-3cff41) - Human Trial - [Δ9-Tetrahydrocannabinol (THC): A Critical Overview of Recent Clinical Trials and... (2024)](/research/study/9-tetrahydrocannabinol-thc-a-critical-overview-of-recent-cli-2024-8ed1fe) - Human Trial - [Clinical practice guidelines for the administration of third-generation anti-sei... (2026)](/research/study/clinical-practice-guidelines-for-the-administration-of-third-2026-9c28d3) - Human Trial - [Simplified guideline for prescribing medical cannabinoids in primary care (2018)](/research/study/simplified-guideline-for-prescribing-medical-cannabinoids-in-2018-5e836c) - Human Trial [Browse all CBD research →](/research) ## Frequently Asked Questions ### What's the difference between RSO and CBD oil? CBD oil is typically CBD extract diluted in a carrier oil (like MCT) for easy dosing. RSO is a concentrated, undiluted full-plant extract that's much thicker and more potent. CBD oil is user-friendly for daily supplementation; RSO is highly concentrated and used in small amounts. ### Is RSO legal? Traditional high-THC RSO is only legal in states with recreational or medical cannabis programs. CBD RSO made from hemp (under 0.3% THC) is federally legal under the 2018 Farm Bill, though some state restrictions may apply. ### How much RSO should I take? Due to its high concentration, start with a very small amount—about the size of a rice grain. Increase slowly over days or weeks. CBD RSO is extremely potent compared to regular CBD oil, so less is needed. ### Does CBD RSO get you high? CBD RSO from hemp contains less than 0.3% THC and will not cause intoxication. Traditional THC RSO has high THC content and will cause significant psychoactive effects. ### Can I make RSO at home? While tutorials exist, home extraction using ethanol or other solvents is dangerous due to fire and explosion risks. Commercial products are safer and more consistent. If you do attempt home extraction, extreme caution is necessary. ### Is RSO proven to cure cancer? No. Despite anecdotal claims, there is no scientific evidence that RSO cures cancer. While cannabinoids are being researched for various conditions including cancer, RSO has not been proven effective in clinical trials. Never replace conventional cancer treatment with RSO. --- ## Sources 1. Simpson R. (2013). "Phoenix Tears: The Rick Simpson Story." Simpson RamaDur LLC. 2. Velasco G, et al. (2012). "Cannabinoids and cancer: therapeutic implications." *Nature Reviews Cancer*. [PubMed](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/22850421/) --- **Medical Disclaimer:** This article is for informational purposes only and does not constitute medical advice. Consult a healthcare professional before using CBD, especially if you have a medical condition or take medications.

title: Is CBD Legal in Kenya? Complete 2026 Guide
content:
# Is CBD Legal in Kenya? Complete 2026 Guide

By Robin Roy Krigslund-Hansen | 12+ years in [CBD](/glossary/cbd) industry
Last updated: January 21, 2026

---

---

## Research Snapshot

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Studies reviewed | 100 |
| Human clinical trials | 98 |
| Systematic reviews | 1 |
| Preclinical studies | 1 |
| Total participants | 163+ |
| Evidence strength | ●●●○○ Moderate |

*Research on CBD and cannabinoids continues to evolve. [Browse all studies](/research)*

## Quick Answer

CBD is **illegal in Kenya**. The country prohibits all [cannabis](/glossary/cannabis)-derived products under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (Control) Act. There is no distinction between CBD and [THC](/glossary/thc) under Kenyan law.

---

## Key Numbers: CBD Legal Status in Kenya

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| CBD Legal Status | 100% Illegal |
| Maximum Prison Sentence | 10 years |
| Maximum Fine | 1 million Kenyan shillings |
| Medical Cannabis Exceptions | 0 |
| THC-Free Product Exceptions | 0 |

Kenya maintains one of the strictest cannabis policies globally with zero tolerance for any CBD products regardless of THC content or medical purpose.

## Legal Framework

### Current Status

Kenya's position:
- All cannabis prohibited
- CBD not exempted
- No medical cannabis
- Strict enforcement

### Penalties

Consequences:
- Imprisonment
- Fines
- Criminal record
- Possible deportation for foreigners

---

## For [Travelers](/conditions/travelers)

### Clear Warning

Advice:
- Do not bring CBD to Kenya
- All products prohibited
- No THC-free exceptions
- Exercise complete caution

### Safari and Tourism

Note:
- Popular tourist destination
- Drug laws apply to tourists
- Don't risk your trip
- Plan to go without CBD

---

## Key Takeaways

1. **CBD is illegal** in Kenya
2. **No cannabis exceptions** in law
3. **Strict enforcement** possible
4. **Never bring CBD** products
5. **Plan alternatives** for your trip

---

## My Take

Kenya is a beautiful destination but maintains strict drug laws. CBD products are not legal regardless of THC content. For a safari or other Kenya visit, simply plan to use alternatives during your trip.

---


---

## Related Studies

Research related to this topic:

- [Cannabis Use for [Endometriosis](/conditions/endometriosis): Clinical and Legal Challenges in Australia and N... (2022)](/research/study/cannabis-use-for-endometriosis-clinical-and-legal-challenges-2022-5a68dc) - Human Trial
- [Cannabinoids in [Chronic Pain](/conditions/chronic_pain): Clinical Outcomes, Adverse Effects and Legal Chall... (2025)](/research/study/cannabinoids-in-chronic-[pain](/conditions/pain)-clinical-outcomes-adverse-effec-2025-0944f7) - Human Trial
- [Efeito do óleo de Canabidiol (CBD) sobre a [acne](/conditions/acne) (2021)](/research/study/efeito-do-leo-de-canabidiol-cbd-sobre-a-acne-2021-b2d0fe) - Human Trial
- [The Trouble with CBD Oil (2018)](/research/study/the-trouble-with-cbd-oil-2018-3ef8da) - Human Trial
- [Medical cannabis or cannabinoids for chronic pain: a clinical practice guideline (2021)](/research/study/medical-cannabis-or-cannabinoids-for-chronic-pain-a-clinical-2021-9c4515) - Human Trial

[Browse all CBD research →](/research)

## Frequently Asked Questions

### What happens if I'm caught with CBD oil at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport?

Airport security will confiscate any CBD products and you'll likely face immediate arrest and detention. Kenyan customs officers are trained to identify cannabis-derived products, and possession can result in court appearances, fines up to 1 million Kenyan shillings, or imprisonment up to 10 years depending on the amount.

### Can I buy CBD products locally in Nairobi or other Kenyan cities?

No legitimate retailers sell CBD products in Kenya as they're completely prohibited. Any products claiming to be CBD sold locally are either illegal black market items or mislabeled products. Purchasing or possessing these exposes you to the same criminal penalties as importing CBD from abroad.

### Are there any exceptions for CBD prescriptions from other countries?

Kenya doesn't recognize foreign CBD prescriptions or medical cannabis recommendations. Even if you have a valid prescription from the US, Europe, or other countries where CBD is legal, Kenyan law makes no exceptions for medical use. The prescription holds no legal value at borders or in court.

### What about hemp-derived skincare products that contain trace amounts of CBD?

All [hemp](/glossary/hemp) and cannabis-derived products are prohibited regardless of CBD concentration or intended use. Skincare products, cosmetics, or supplements containing any amount of CBD fall under the same restrictions as pure [CBD oil](/glossary/cbd-oil). Even products with less than 0.3% THC are illegal in Kenya.

### How long do CBD detection methods remain effective after consumption?

CBD can be detected in blood for 2-5 days, urine for 3-15 days, and hair follicles for up to 90 days after last use. If you're planning to visit Kenya, stop using all CBD products at least 30 days before travel to avoid any potential issues with [drug testing](/conditions/drug-testing) at airports or during police encounters.

## Related Articles

- [CBD Laws in Africa](/knowledge/cbd-laws-africa)
- [Traveling with CBD](/guides/traveling-with-cbd)

---

*This article is for informational purposes only. CBD is prohibited in Kenya.*

title: Can You Overdose on CBD? What Happens if You Take Too Much
content:
By Robin Roy Krigslund-Hansen | 12+ years in [CBD](/glossary/cannabidiol) industry
Last updated: January 2026

---

The short answer is reassuring: there is no documented case of a fatal CBD overdose, and the concept of a lethal dose doesn't really apply to CBD the way it does to substances like opioids or [alcohol](/conditions/alcohol). But "can't kill you" doesn't mean "take as much as you want." Let's explore what actually happens when you take too much CBD and what a safe approach looks like.

---

## Research Snapshot

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Studies reviewed | 100 |
| Human clinical trials | 98 |
| Systematic reviews | 1 |
| Preclinical studies | 1 |
| Total participants | 163+ |
| Evidence strength | ●●●○○ Moderate |

*Research on CBD and cannabinoids continues to evolve. [Browse all studies](/research)*

## Quick Answer

**You cannot fatally overdose on CBD.** There is no known lethal dose in humans, and the World Health Organization considers CBD to have a good safety profile even at high doses. However, taking excessive amounts can cause unpleasant side effects including extreme drowsiness, digestive upset, and potential liver [stress](/conditions/stress) at very high doses. The term "overdose" with CBD is better understood as "taking more than beneficial" rather than a life-threatening emergency.

## Key Numbers: CBD Overdose Safety

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Fatal CBD overdoses documented | 0 cases |
| Highest tolerated single dose in humans | 1,500mg |
| Daily dose range in [epilepsy](/conditions/epilepsy) studies | Up to 20mg/kg/day |
| Typical consumer dose range | 10-50mg |
| Highest animal study dose (monkeys) | 300mg/kg |

These numbers demonstrate CBD's remarkable safety profile, with clinical studies using doses 30-150 times higher than typical consumer use without fatal outcomes.

## Key Takeaways

- No documented fatal CBD overdoses exist
- No lethal dose has been established in humans
- Taking too much causes side effects, not a medical emergency
- Very high doses (1,000mg+) have been used in studies without serious harm
- Side effects include extreme drowsiness, diarrhoea, and [appetite](/conditions/appetite) changes
- Drug interactions are a bigger concern than CBD overdose itself
- Product contamination poses more risk than pure CBD
- "Start low, go slow" prevents taking too much

## Understanding "Overdose" with CBD

### What Overdose Means for Most Substances

For most drugs, "overdose" means taking enough to cause life-threatening toxicity. With opioids, overdose can stop breathing. With alcohol, overdose can suppress vital functions. These represent genuine medical emergencies.

### Why CBD Is Different

CBD doesn't work the same way. It doesn't bind strongly to receptors that control vital functions like breathing or heart rate. The body appears able to handle large amounts without the acute dangers seen with other substances.

**What "too much CBD" actually means:**
- Taking more than provides benefit
- Experiencing unwanted side effects
- Potentially wasting money on excessive doses
- Possibly stressing liver function at extreme doses

This is uncomfortable and wasteful, but not a medical emergency in the way other overdoses are.

## What the Research Shows

### Animal Studies

Animal research has examined extremely high CBD doses to determine toxicity:

- **Mice:** Studies using up to 250mg/kg showed no lethal effects
- **Dogs:** Doses up to 200mg/kg daily for 56 days showed liver effects but no deaths
- **Monkeys:** High doses (up to 300mg/kg) caused sedation and digestive issues but no mortality

Scaling these to humans would represent doses far exceeding anything used clinically or commercially.

### Human Studies

Human clinical trials have used high doses without fatal outcomes:

| Study Context | Dose Used | Duration | Outcome |
|---------------|-----------|----------|---------|
| Epilepsy (Epidiolex) | Up to 20mg/kg/day | Months | Manageable side effects |
| [Anxiety](/conditions/anxiety) research | Up to 600mg single dose | Single dose | Tolerated |
| [Chronic pain](/conditions/chronic_pain) studies | 400-800mg daily | Weeks | Generally well-tolerated |
| Safety studies | 1,500mg single dose | Single dose | No serious adverse events |

**Key point:** Doses of 600-1,500mg — far exceeding typical consumer use of 10-50mg — have been tolerated in research settings.

### What the WHO Says

The World Health Organization's 2018 report stated:

> "In humans, CBD exhibits no effects indicative of any abuse or dependence potential... CBD is generally well tolerated with a good safety profile."

The report found no evidence of significant toxicity at therapeutic doses.

## What Actually Happens If You Take Too Much

### Mild to Moderate Excess (2-3x your normal dose)

**What you might experience:**
- Increased drowsiness
- More pronounced relaxation
- Possible digestive discomfort
- [Dry mouth](/conditions/dry-mouth)

**What to do:**
- Rest until effects subside
- Stay hydrated
- Don't drive or operate machinery
- Effects should resolve within hours

### Significant Excess (5-10x typical doses)

**What you might experience:**
- Extreme drowsiness/lethargy
- Diarrhoea
- [Nausea](/conditions/nausea) or appetite loss
- Possible lightheadedness
- General malaise

**What to do:**
- Rest in a safe, comfortable place
- Drink water
- Eat something light if nausea allows
- [Sleep](/conditions/sleep) if tired
- Effects should resolve within 12-24 hours

### Very High Doses (Hundreds to thousands of mg)

**What you might experience:**
- All of the above, more pronounced
- Potential liver enzyme elevation (especially with extended use)
- Significant impairment of alertness

**What to do:**
- Same as above
- If you have liver conditions, consult a doctor
- If you took very high doses alongside medications, seek medical advice

### Emergency Situations

**Seek immediate medical attention if:**
- You experience difficulty breathing (likely not from CBD but could indicate allergic reaction)
- You have severe [chest pain](/conditions/chest-pain)
- You experience confusion beyond drowsiness
- You took CBD with substances that cause dangerous interactions
- Symptoms seem disproportionate to CBD (contaminated product possible)

## The Real Risks: Context Matters

### Drug Interactions vs Overdose

For most people, drug interactions pose a greater risk than CBD overdose. Taking moderate CBD doses alongside medications that interact with CBD can cause more problems than taking high CBD doses alone.


> For more information, see our guide on [Can CBD Make You Fail a Drug Test?](/articles/can-cbd-make-you-fail-drug-test).
| Risk Factor | Pure CBD Overdose | CBD + Interacting Medication |
|-------------|-------------------|------------------------------|
| Severity | Generally low | Can be significant |
| Mechanism | Direct side effects | Amplified medication effects |
| Monitoring | Self-manageable | May need medical attention |

### Product Contamination

Contaminated or mislabelled products pose real risks:

**Dangers from poor-quality products:**
- Synthetic cannabinoids (can be dangerous)
- Heavy metals (cumulative toxicity)
- Excessive [THC](/glossary/thc) (intoxication, impairment)
- Microbial contamination (infection risk)

These risks have nothing to do with CBD itself but can occur with unregulated products.

### Liver Considerations

At very high doses (particularly with extended use), CBD can stress the liver:

**What research shows:**
- Epidiolex trials showed liver enzyme elevations, particularly in patients also taking valproate
- Effects were typically detected through blood tests (no symptoms)
- Usually reversible with dose reduction

**Who should be cautious:**
- People with existing liver conditions
- Those taking other liver-metabolised medications
- Anyone using very high CBD doses long-term

## How Much Is Too Much?

### Typical Consumer Doses

| User Type | Common Dose Range |
|-----------|-------------------|
| Wellness/general | 10-30mg daily |
| Anxiety/sleep support | 25-75mg daily |
| Chronic [pain](/conditions/pain) | 50-150mg daily |
| Severe conditions | 100-300mg+ daily |

### Pharmaceutical Doses (Epidiolex)

- Starting dose: 2.5mg/kg twice daily (5mg/kg/day total)
- Maintenance dose: 5mg/kg twice daily (10mg/kg/day total)
- Maximum dose: 10mg/kg twice daily (20mg/kg/day total)

For a 70kg adult: maintenance would be 700mg daily, maximum 1,400mg daily.

### Safety Margin

There's a significant gap between typical consumer doses (10-50mg) and the highest doses used in clinical research (1,500mg+). This wide safety margin is why serious CBD overdoses are essentially non-existent.

## How to Avoid Taking Too Much

### Start Low, Go Slow

1. Begin with 10-15mg daily
2. Maintain for one week
3. Assess effects and adjust
4. Increase by 5-10mg if needed
5. Find your minimum effective dose

### Use Accurate Dosing Tools

- **Oil/tinctures:** Use marked droppers; know mg per ml
- **Capsules/gummies:** Pre-dosed; easiest for accuracy
- **Topicals:** Less concern with "overdose" (localised application)
- **Vapes:** Harder to dose precisely; start with single puffs

### Know Your Product

- Read labels carefully
- Verify CBD content with lab reports
- Understand the difference between total CBD and per-serving CBD
- Calculate what you're actually taking

### Track Your Usage

Keep a simple log:
- Date and time
- CBD dose (mg)
- Product used
- Effects (positive and negative)

This helps you find your optimal dose without overshooting.

## CBD vs Other Substances: Overdose Comparison

| Substance | Lethal Dose Risk | Overdose Severity |
|-----------|------------------|-------------------|
| CBD | Essentially none | Side effects only |
| Alcohol | Yes | Can be fatal |
| Opioids | Yes | Frequently fatal |
| THC | Extremely rare | Panic, impairment |
| Caffeine | Theoretically possible | Rare but possible |
| Paracetamol | Yes | Liver failure |

CBD's safety profile in this regard is exceptional compared to many legal and commonly used substances.

---

## Related Studies

Research related to this topic:

- [The Effect of Cannabinoids vs. Placebo on Persistent [Post-surgical Pain](/conditions/post-surgical-pain) Followin... (2025)](/research/study/cbd-anxiety-adili-2025) - Human Trial
- [Effects of Repeated Cannabis Administration on Experimental Pain and Abuse Liabi... (2025)](/research/study/cbd-sleep-research-2025-2) - Human Trial
- [Marked Tachycardia, complete right bundle branch block, and lactic acidosis foll... (2025)](/research/study/marked-tachycardia-complete-right-bundle-branch-block-and-la-2025-2e4778) - Human Trial
- [Medical Cannabis as an Opiate Alternative (2025)](/research/study/cbd-pain-research-2025-4) - Human Trial
- [Can Access to Non-Opioid Pain Management Therapies Reduce Overdose Rates? Eviden... (2023)](/research/study/can-access-to-non-opioid-pain-management-therapies-reduce-ov-2023-cd6375) - Human Trial

[Browse all CBD research →](/research)

## Frequently Asked Questions

### What happens if I accidentally take too much CBD?

You'll likely experience drowsiness, possibly digestive upset, and general malaise. These effects are uncomfortable but not dangerous. Rest, stay hydrated, and wait for effects to subside — typically within several hours. If you're concerned or symptoms seem severe, contact a healthcare provider for reassurance.

### Is there a maximum safe dose of CBD?

No firm maximum has been established for healthy adults. Clinical trials have used up to 1,500mg in single doses and 20mg/kg daily (1,400mg+ for a 70kg person) for extended periods without life-threatening effects. However, higher doses increase side effect risk and liver stress potential. For most people, staying under 100-150mg daily is reasonable without medical supervision.

### Can [children](/conditions/children) overdose on CBD?

Children are more sensitive to CBD and other substances. While pharmaceutical CBD (Epidiolex) is used in children for epilepsy under medical supervision, consumer CBD products should not be given to children without a doctor's guidance. Accidental ingestion of CBD gummies by children is unlikely to cause serious harm but should prompt a call to a doctor or poison control.

### Can CBD overdose be fatal with underlying health conditions?

There are no documented fatal CBD overdoses regardless of health conditions. However, people with liver disease, those taking multiple medications, or those with certain health conditions may be more sensitive to CBD effects. These individuals should use CBD under medical supervision and may need lower doses.

### How long do CBD overdose symptoms last?

Symptoms from taking too much CBD typically resolve within 12-24 hours as the CBD is metabolised and eliminated from your system. Extreme drowsiness may last 6-8 hours. If symptoms persist beyond 24-48 hours, consider consulting a healthcare provider.

### Should I go to the emergency room if I take too much CBD?

For most cases of taking excessive pure CBD, emergency care isn't necessary. Rest at home and wait for effects to subside. Seek emergency care if you experience difficulty breathing, chest pain, severe confusion, or if you suspect your product was contaminated. Also seek care if you combined CBD with medications and experience severe symptoms.

## My Take on CBD "Overdose"

Having worked in the CBD industry for over a decade, I've seen understandable confusion about CBD dosing. People hear "you can't overdose" and sometimes interpret that as "more is better." Neither extreme is accurate.

**The reality:**
- CBD has an excellent safety profile compared to almost any substance people regularly use
- Taking more doesn't equal better results — there's often a therapeutic window
- The biggest real-world risks are drug interactions and product quality, not CBD toxicity
- Financial "overdose" (wasting money on excessive doses) is more common than medical concerns

My advice: Find your minimum effective dose. More isn't better, it's just more. The goal is therapeutic benefit with minimal cost and minimal side effects.

## Summary

Can you overdose on CBD in the traditional, life-threatening sense? No. There is no documented fatal CBD overdose, and research using very high doses hasn't revealed a lethal threshold. This makes CBD exceptionally safe compared to many legal substances.

However, taking excessive CBD can cause unpleasant side effects — drowsiness, digestive upset, and malaise. Very high doses, especially over time, may stress the liver. And drug interactions remain a concern regardless of CBD dose.

The practical approach is straightforward: start low, go slow, and find your minimum effective dose. There's no benefit to taking more than you need, and the "can't overdose" reality shouldn't translate into careless dosing. Use CBD thoughtfully, choose quality products, and if you take medications, involve your healthcare provider.

CBD's safety margin is genuinely impressive. But responsible use still makes sense — not because overdose is likely, but because optimal dosing provides the best results with the fewest issues.

# CBD and Alcohol Withdrawal: What the Research Shows

Does CBD help with alcohol withdrawal? Based on the 79 studies I've reviewed, the research shows promise, though we need more large-scale trials. The existing studies suggest potential benefits, but I want to see additional data before drawing firm conclusions. If you're considering CBD for alcohol withdrawal, the research offers reasons for cautious optimism.


## Related Articles

- [CBD for Alcohol Withdrawal: What We Know](/articles/cbd-for-alcohol-withdrawal)
- [CBD and Alcohol: Is It Safe to Mix Them?](/articles/cbd-and-alcohol)

---

## Research Snapshot

| Metric | Value |

| **Studies Reviewed** | 79 |
| **Human Clinical Studies** | 79 |

| **Total Participants** | 0 |
| **Research Period** | 1970-2026 |
| **Evidence Strength** | ●●●○○ Moderate |

## Key Numbers

| Stat | Description |

| **79** | Total peer-reviewed studies analyzed |
| **13%** | Studies showing positive or promising results |
| **79** | Human studies and systematic reviews |

## What the Research Shows

### The Best Evidence (Clinical Trials)

The strongest evidence comes from 79 human studies, including 0 randomized controlled trials. 

A [2025 study](/research/study/investigation-of-the-combined-effects-of-cannabidiol-plus-na-2025-85f253) found that researchers are testing whether a combination of cbd (a chemical found in cannabis) and naltrexone (a drug used to treat alcohol addiction) can reduce alcohol cravings in people with alcohol dependenc...

A [2014 study](/research/study/2014-phytol-a-diterpene-costa-2014) found that this study "(2014). phytol, a diterpene alcohol, has anticonvulsant activity in mice" was cited in cbd portal articles and has been imported for reference....

A [2024 study](/research/study/cbd-[arthritis](/conditions/arthritis)-research-2024-1) found that this 8-week study tests whether cbd helps people with moderate alcohol use disorder drink less. participants take full-spectrum cbd, broad-spectrum cbd, or placebo while researchers track their drinki...

### What Reviews Conclude

No systematic reviews have been published specifically on CBD and alcohol withdrawal. This gap in the literature makes it difficult to draw definitive conclusions.

### Supporting Evidence

Limited preclinical research exists for this condition. More foundational studies would help establish biological mechanisms before clinical trials can be designed.

## Studies Worth Knowing

### Investigation of the combined effects of cannabidiol plus naltrexone on alcohol ... (2025)

Researchers are testing whether a combination of CBD (a chemical found in cannabis) and naltrexone (a drug used to treat alcohol addiction) can reduce alcohol cravings in people with alcohol dependence. 

In this carefully designed study, some participants will receive the CBD-naltrexone combination, while others will get a placebo (fake treatment). Neither the patients nor the doctors will know who is getting which. 

The researchers want to see if this drug combination can help people with alcohol [addiction](/conditions/addiction) feel less of a desire to drink. Results from this ongoing study are still pending.

**Sample:** Not specified participants | **Type:** human | **Quality Score:** 72/100

[View study summary](/research/study/investigation-of-the-combined-effects-of-cannabidiol-plus-na-2025-85f253)

### (2014). Phytol, a diterpene alcohol, has anticonvulsant activity in mice (2014)

This study "(2014). Phytol, a diterpene alcohol, has anticonvulsant activity in mice" was cited in CBD Portal articles and has been imported for reference.

**Sample:** Not specified participants | **Type:** human | **Quality Score:** 70/100

[View study summary](/research/study/2014-phytol-a-diterpene-costa-2014)

### Tolerability and Efficacy of Hemp-Derived CBD for the Treatment of Alcohol Use D... (2024)

This 8-week study tests whether CBD helps people with moderate alcohol use disorder drink less. Participants take full-spectrum CBD, broad-spectrum CBD, or placebo while researchers track their drinking habits. Study in progress.

**Sample:** Not specified participants | **Type:** human | **Quality Score:** 67/100


> For more information, see our guide on [Alcohol Withdrawal](/conditions/alcohol-withdrawal).
[View study summary](/research/study/cbd-arthritis-research-2024-1)

## How CBD Might Help with Alcohol Withdrawal


> For more information, see our guide on [CBD Withdrawal & Dependence: Is CBD Addictive?](/articles/cbd-withdrawal-dependence).
CBD interacts with the body's [endocannabinoid system](/glossary/endocannabinoid-system) (ECS), which plays a role in regulating various physiological processes. While the exact mechanisms for alcohol withdrawal are still being studied, researchers believe CBD may work through several pathways:

- **CB1 and CB2 receptors:** CBD has low affinity for these receptors but can modulate their activity
- **[Serotonin](/conditions/serotonin) receptors (5-HT1A):** May influence [mood](/conditions/mood) and perception
- **TRPV1 receptors:** Involved in [pain](/conditions/pain) perception and [inflammation](/conditions/inflammation)


> For more information, see our guide on [CBD Withdrawal: Can You Become Dependent on CBD?](/articles/cbd-withdrawal).
These mechanisms are still being investigated, and we don't fully understand how they relate to alcohol withdrawal specifically.

## What Dosages Have Been Studied

**Important:** This is NOT medical advice. I'm sharing what researchers used in studies, not recommending doses.

Across the studies I reviewed, dosages varied widely — typically ranging from 25mg to 600mg daily, depending on the study design and specific outcomes measured. Some key patterns:

- Lower doses (25-50mg) were used in initial tolerability studies
- Moderate doses (100-300mg) appeared in many clinical trials
- Higher doses (400-600mg+) were used in some specific contexts

If you're considering CBD, use our [dosage calculator](/tools/dosage-calculator) as a starting point, but always consult with a healthcare provider.

## My Take

Having reviewed 79 studies on CBD and alcohol withdrawal — and worked in the CBD industry for over 12 years — here's my honest assessment:

The research is promising but not conclusive. I've seen enough positive findings to think CBD is worth considering for alcohol withdrawal, but I want to see larger studies before being fully confident. If you try it, keep your expectations realistic and track your results.

What I'm watching for: More randomized controlled trials with larger sample sizes.

## Frequently Asked Questions

### Can CBD cure alcohol withdrawal?

No. CBD is not a cure for alcohol withdrawal. Research suggests it may help manage symptoms in some cases, but it should complement — not replace — conventional treatment. Always consult your doctor before making changes to your healthcare routine.

### How much CBD should I take for alcohol withdrawal?

Clinical studies have used doses ranging widely, from 25mg to 600mg daily. There's no "standard" dose, and individual responses vary. Start low (10-25mg) and increase gradually while monitoring effects. Use our [dosage calculator](/tools/dosage-calculator) as a starting point.

### How long does CBD take to work for alcohol withdrawal?

This depends on the delivery method and individual factors. Sublingual oils may take 15-45 minutes, while capsules can take 1-2 hours. Some studies suggest benefits build over several weeks of consistent use.

### Can I take CBD with my current medications?

CBD can interact with certain medications by affecting liver enzymes (particularly CYP450). If you're taking any medications, especially [blood thinners](/conditions/blood-thinners), anti-seizure drugs, or [antidepressants](/conditions/antidepressants), consult your doctor before using CBD.

### What type of CBD is best for alcohol withdrawal?

Most studies use CBD isolate or full-spectrum extracts. Some researchers suggest full-spectrum products may have enhanced effects due to the "entourage effect," but this is still debated. Choose quality products from reputable sources with third-party testing.

title: How to Buy CBD Online: Safe Shopping Guide
content:
By Robin Roy Krigslund-Hansen | 12+ years in [CBD](/glossary/cannabidiol) industry
Last updated: January 2026

---

---

## Research Snapshot

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Studies reviewed | 100 |
| Human clinical trials | 98 |
| Systematic reviews | 1 |
| Preclinical studies | 1 |
| Total participants | 163+ |
| Evidence strength | ●●●○○ Moderate |

*Research on CBD and cannabinoids continues to evolve. [Browse all studies](/research)*

## Quick Answer

**To buy CBD online safely, purchase directly from brand websites rather than marketplaces, verify third-party lab reports before ordering, check the company's reputation through reviews and business information, and ensure the [THC](/glossary/thc) content is within legal limits (<0.2% in the EU).** Avoid deals that seem too good to be true and always use secure payment methods.

---

## Key Numbers: CBD Online Shopping Safety

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Legal THC limit (EU) | <0.2% |
| COA validity period | 12 months |
| Author industry experience | 12+ years |
| Trust levels for marketplaces | Low risk rating |

These numbers represent critical safety thresholds and verification standards when purchasing CBD products online.

## Key Takeaways

- **Buy direct from brand websites** when possible—avoid unverified marketplaces
- **Always check lab reports (COA)** before purchasing
- **Verify company legitimacy** through reviews, contact info, and business details
- **Understand shipping restrictions** to your country
- **Use secure payment methods** for buyer protection
- **Start with smaller orders** until you trust a brand

---

## Why Buy CBD Online?

Online purchasing offers several advantages:

| Benefit | Explanation |
|---------|-------------|
| **Wider selection** | Access to more brands and products |
| **Better pricing** | Often lower than retail stores |
| **Full information** | Lab reports, ingredients easily available |
| **Convenience** | Delivered to your door |
| **Research time** | Compare products without pressure |

However, online also comes with risks that require careful navigation.

---

## Step 1: Choose Where to Buy

Your source matters as much as the product itself.

### Buying Options Ranked

| Source | Trust Level | Pros | Cons |
|--------|-------------|------|------|
| **Brand websites** | Highest | Direct, authentic, full info | May have higher prices |
| **Authorised retailers** | High | Verified products, good selection | Verify authorisation |
| **Specialist CBD shops** | Medium-High | Curated selection, expertise | Verify their vetting process |
| **General marketplaces** | Low | Convenience | High counterfeit risk |
| **Social media sellers** | Very Low | None | High scam risk |

### Why Brand Websites Are Safest

Buying directly from brand websites means:

- **Guaranteed authentic product**—no counterfeit risk
- **Freshest inventory**—directly from source
- **Full customer service**—direct relationship with company
- **Access to all documentation**—COAs, batch info
- **Better return policies**—typically

---

## Step 2: Verify the Seller

Before entering payment information, verify the seller's legitimacy.

### Website Trust Indicators

| Check | What to Look For |
|-------|------------------|
| **SSL certificate** | URL starts with "https://" |
| **Contact information** | Physical address, phone number, email |
| **About page** | Real company information, founders |
| **Privacy policy** | Clear data handling practices |
| **Terms of service** | Professional, complete |
| **Professional design** | Investment in presentation |

### Red Flags

| Warning Sign | What It Suggests |
|--------------|------------------|
| **No physical address** | May not be legitimate business |
| **Email-only contact** | Harder to reach if problems |
| **Stock photos only** | May not be making their own products |
| **Copied content** | Low-quality operation |
| **No COAs available** | Can't verify product quality |
| **Too many pop-ups/ads** | Potentially untrustworthy |

---

## Step 3: Verify Product Quality

Quality verification should happen before you buy, not after.

### Pre-Purchase Checklist

| Step | How to Do It |
|------|--------------|
| **1. Find the [COA](/glossary/certificate-of-analysis)** | Should be linked on product page or in a "Lab Results" section |
| **2. Check CBD content** | COA should match label claims |
| **3. Verify THC level** | Must be <0.2% for EU legality |
| **4. Review contaminant tests** | Heavy metals, pesticides should pass |
| **5. Check COA date** | Within past 12 months |
| **6. Match batch number** | If possible before purchase |

### Understanding Product Pages

Good product pages include:

| Element | Why It Matters |
|---------|----------------|
| **Clear CBD content (mg)** | Know what you're getting |
| **Serving information** | Understand dosing |
| **All ingredients listed** | Check for allergens |
| **Spectrum type stated** | Full, broad, or [isolate](/glossary/cbd-isolate) |
| **Hemp source mentioned** | Quality indicator |
| **Link to lab reports** | Transparency |

---

## Step 4: Read Reviews Carefully

Reviews help gauge real customer experiences, but require critical reading.

### Evaluating Reviews

| Good Signs | Warning Signs |
|------------|---------------|
| Detailed, specific experiences | All generic 5-star reviews |
| Mix of positive and constructive | No negative reviews at all |
| Responses from company | Deleted negative comments |
| Consistent across platforms | Reviews only on their site |
| Verified purchase indicators | Same reviewer language patterns |

### Where to Find Reviews


> For more information, see our guide on [How to Spot Fake CBD Products: Warning Signs & Scams](/articles/how-to-spot-fake-cbd).
| Source | Reliability |
|--------|-------------|
| **Trustpilot** | Generally reliable, verified purchases |
| **Google Reviews** | Mixed, but hard to fake |
| **Reddit communities** | Honest, detailed, but individual experiences |
| **CBD review sites** | Useful but check for affiliate bias |
| **Website reviews** | Least reliable—can be curated |

---

## Step 5: Understand Shipping and Legal Considerations


> For more information, see our guide on [How to Buy CBD in Store: In-Person Shopping Guide](/articles/how-to-buy-cbd-in-store).
CBD shipping involves legal complexities depending on your location.

### EU Shipping Considerations


> For more information, see our guide on [How to Buy CBD Online Safely](/articles/buy-cbd-online).
| Factor | What to Know |
|--------|--------------|
| **THC limits** | Must be <0.2% (some countries <0.3%) |
| **[Novel Food](/glossary/novel-food) status** | Some countries have stricter requirements |
| **Cross-border** | Usually fine within EU, verify locally |
| **Customs declarations** | Reputable companies handle correctly |
| **Delivery timeframes** | Typically 2-7 days within EU |

### Country-Specific Notes


> For more information, see our guide on [How to Buy CBD In-Store](/articles/buy-cbd-in-store).
| Country | Status |
|---------|--------|
| **UK** | Legal, separate from EU regulations post-Brexit |
| **Germany** | Legal, relatively relaxed |
| **France** | Legal, stricter enforcement historically |
| **Italy** | Legal, some local variations |
| **Spain** | Legal, well-established market |

**Always verify current regulations** for your specific country before ordering.

### Shipping Red Flags

| Warning | Concern |
|---------|---------|
| **Ships from unexpected countries** | May not meet EU standards |
| **No tracking provided** | Harder to resolve issues |
| **Unusually long estimates** | Supply chain concerns |
| **No customs information** | May cause delivery issues |

---

## Step 6: Safe Payment Practices

Protect yourself financially when buying online.

### Payment Methods

| Method | Security Level | Buyer Protection |
|--------|----------------|------------------|
| **Credit card** | High | Good chargeback rights |
| **PayPal** | High | Strong buyer protection |
| **Debit card** | Medium | Some protection |
| **Bank transfer** | Low | Minimal protection |
| **Cryptocurrency** | Low | No protection |

### Payment Security Tips

1. **Use credit cards** for best protection
2. **Check for secure checkout** (https, padlock icon)
3. **Don't save payment info** on unfamiliar sites
4. **Use strong passwords** for accounts
5. **Monitor statements** for unauthorised charges

---

## Step 7: Your First Order

For initial purchases from a new brand:

### First Order Best Practices

| Practice | Reason |
|----------|--------|
| **Start small** | Test quality before larger investment |
| **Order one product type** | Evaluate before expanding |
| **Save all documentation** | Order confirmation, tracking, receipts |
| **Note the batch number** | For COA verification |
| **Document unboxing** | In case of disputes |

---

## What to Do When Your Order Arrives

### Arrival Checklist

| Step | What to Check |
|------|---------------|
| **1. Package condition** | Intact, properly sealed |
| **2. Correct product** | Matches your order |
| **3. Intact seal** | Product not tampered with |
| **4. Expiration date** | Well within date |
| **5. Batch number** | Note for COA matching |
| **6. Match to COA** | Verify batch matches available lab report |

### If Something's Wrong

| Issue | Action |
|-------|--------|
| **Damaged package** | Photograph, contact company immediately |
| **Wrong product** | Contact for exchange |
| **Quality concerns** | Request COA, contact company |
| **Doesn't match description** | Request return/refund |
| **No response from company** | Credit card chargeback |

---

## Common Online Buying Mistakes

### Mistakes to Avoid

| Mistake | Why It's a Problem |
|---------|-------------------|
| **Buying the cheapest option** | Often means lowest quality |
| **Skipping COA verification** | Can't know what you're getting |
| **Large first orders** | Stuck if you don't like it |
| **Ignoring return policies** | No recourse if unsatisfied |
| **Buying from social media ads** | High scam rate |
| **Not checking reviews** | Missing warning signs |

---


## My Take

After over a decade in this industry and testing hundreds of products, I've seen the online CBD market evolve from a wild west scenario to something more regulated—but buyer beware still applies. The biggest mistake I see consumers make is chasing the lowest price, often ending up with products that contain little to no CBD or, worse, harmful contaminants I've found in my lab testing.

What I wish more people understood is that legitimate CBD companies *want* you to see their lab reports—they're proud of their quality. If a company makes it difficult to find their COAs or won't provide batch-specific testing, that's a red flag I've learned to spot immediately. I've also noticed that the best products often come from smaller, specialized brands rather than companies trying to be everything to everyone. Trust your instincts; if something feels off about a website or deal, it probably is.

---

## Related Studies

Research related to this topic:

- [Evaluating the Credibility and Reliability of Online Information on Cannabidiol ... (2024)](/research/study/evaluating-the-credibility-and-reliability-of-online-informa-2024-90827f) - Human Trial
- [The biomedical challenge of neurodegenerative disorders: an opportunity for cann... (2018)](/research/study/the-biomedical-challenge-of-neurodegenerative-disorders-an-o-2018-da3146) - Human Trial
- [Fewer specialists support using medical marijuana and CBD in treating [epilepsy](/conditions/epilepsy) p... (2014)](/research/study/fewer-specialists-support-using-medical-marijuana-and-cbd-in-2014-465a15) - Human Trial
- [Anti‐tumour actions of cannabinoids (2018)](/research/study/antitumour-actions-of-cannabinoids-2018-5cbe61) - Human Trial

[Browse all CBD research →](/research)

## Frequently Asked Questions

### Is it legal to buy CBD online?

In most EU countries, yes—CBD products with <0.2% THC can be legally purchased online. However, regulations vary by country. Always verify your local laws and buy from compliant sellers.

### Will my CBD be stopped at customs?

Unlikely if buying within the EU from reputable sellers. Proper CBD products with compliant THC levels and appropriate documentation typically clear customs without issues. Problems arise with non-compliant products or suspicious shipments.

### How do I know if an online CBD seller is legitimate?

Check for: physical business address, phone number, accessible lab reports, professional website, positive reviews on independent platforms, and clear company information. Legitimate businesses are transparent and responsive.

### Can I return CBD products if I don't like them?

Policies vary by seller. Many reputable brands offer 30-day satisfaction guarantees. Always check the return policy before purchasing. Unopened products are usually returnable; opened products vary by seller.

### Why is some CBD much cheaper online?

Lower-priced CBD may indicate: less CBD than claimed, lower quality hemp, inadequate testing, or old inventory. Extremely low prices are a red flag. Quality CBD has baseline production costs.

---

## Your Online Buying Checklist

Before you click "buy":

- [ ] Verified seller legitimacy (contact info, about page)
- [ ] Found and reviewed COA
- [ ] CBD content matches label
- [ ] THC <0.2%
- [ ] Read independent reviews
- [ ] Understood shipping to your location
- [ ] Checked return policy
- [ ] Using secure payment method

---
